content:
• Wednesday, February 28, 2018
  • LB

    L Brands posts Q4 beat but guides Q1, full-year earnings below consensus

    • L Brands (NYSE:LB) -7.5% after-hours despite beating Q4 earnings and revenue expectations, as the fashion retailer issues downside guidance for Q1 and the full year.
    • Q4 adjusted EPS of $2.11 beat estimates and topped the year-earlier quarter's $2.03, and sales rose to a better than expected $4.82B compared with $4.49B a year ago.
    • But company guidance is disappointing: LB sees Q1 EPS of $0.15-$0.20 vs. $0.31 analyst consensus estimate and FY 2018 EPS of $2.95-$3.25 vs. $3.43 consensus.
    • LB also announces a proposed $500M offering of senior notes due 2028 for the redemption of outstanding senior notes due next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • NVAX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/28/2018)

    • Top gainers: NVAX +22.5%. DDD +15.9%. QEP +12.5%. BLDR +6.9%. CHTR +6.9%.
    • Top losers: PTLA -29.0%. BOX -13.9%. LB -8.8%. RRD -8.5%. MNST -7.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 13 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems +14.7% after delaying Q4 report, includes upside prelim results

    • 3D Systems (NYSE:DDD) soars 14.7% after announcing the company will delay filing its 10-K and will now hold its Q4 and FY17 call on March 14.
    • Company says the delay is related to accounting for product warranty revenue and costs. 
    • Preliminary results have revenue from $176M to $178M (consensus: $162.23M) and EPS of $0.03 to $0.05 (consensus: $0.02). 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: 3D printing stocks drop after Stratasys earnings (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 14 Comments
  • MCHP

    Dealreporter: Microchip Tech deal could value Microsemi at $69/share

    • Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) could offer Microsemi (NASDAQ:MSCC) a deal that values it at $68 to $69 per share in cash, according to the Dealreporter via Bloomberg First Word.
    • Microsemi shareholders could refuse the deal since the offer falls below the $70/share value estimated by analysts. 
    • Microsemi previously had talks with Renesas, which walked away, and Qorvo. 
    • Microchip shares are up 1.2% aftermarket.  
    • Previously: Needham: Microsemi acquisition could be "immediately accretive" for MCHP (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • MYL

    Mylan Q4 top line off 1%; earnings down 42%; shares up 1% after hours

    • Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 3,238.9 (-0.9%); North America: 1,302.9 (-16.7%); Europe: 1,071.2 (+15.5%).
    • Net Income: 244.3 (-41.5%); non-GAAP net income: 765.3 (-9.1%); EPS: 0.46 (-41.0%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.43 (-8.9%).
    • EBITDA: 962.2 (+9.5%); non-GAAP EBITDA: 1,123.6 (-7.3%).
    • 2018 guidance: Revenues: $11.75B - 13.25B; non-GAAP EBITDA: $4.0B - 4.5B; non-GAAP net income: $2.7B - 2.9B; non-GAAP EPS: $5.20 - 5.60.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours on average volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • BOX

    Box -10.6% on Q4 report with in-line revenue, downside revenue guidance

    • Box (NYSE:BOX) plunges 10.6% aftermarket following Q4 results that met revenue estimates with a 24.3% Y/Y increase and beat on EPS, narrowing the net loss by four cents on the year to $0.24. 
    • Box changed from ASC 605 to ASC 606 and that's reflected in the guidance. 
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue expected from $139M to $140M (consensus: $144.30M). Under old 605 standard, revenue was expected from $142M to $143M, which makes either scenario a downside. In-line EPS expected from -$0.09 to -$0.048 in ASC 606 and 605 (consensus: -$0.08). 
    • FY18 guidance: Downside revenue expected from $602M to $608M in 606 (consensus: $625.67) and $613M to $619M in 605.  In-line EPS from -$0.20 to -$0.16 in 606 (consensus: -$0.20) and downside EPS from -$0.28 to -$0.24 in 605. 
    • Key metrics: Billings, $204.6M (+28% Y/Y); Deferred revenue, $320.9M (+33%); cash flow from operations, $48.7M (+$34M); operating expenses, $133.9M; FCF, $13.3M (+$3.2M); cash and equivalents, $208.1M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release         
    • Previously: Box beats by $0.02, revenue in-line (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 17 Comments
  • QEP

    QEP Resources +6% on renewed push to the Permian

    • QEP Resources (NYSE:QEP) +6.1% after-hours as it reports a surprise Q4 profit as well as better than expected revenues, and announces strategic initiatives to transition to a pure-play Permian Basin company.
    • QEP says it has engaged financial advisors to assist with the sale of its Williston and Uinta basin assets, with data rooms expected to be opened in late March or early April, and expects to market its Haynesville and other remaining non-Permian assets in H2 2018; the company also authorizes a $1.25 stock buyback program.
    • QEP says it anticipates 2018 capex of $1.075B, with 65% to be directed toward the Permian Basin.
    • During Q4, QEP's production was 12.1M boe vs. 13.7M boe for theyear-ago quarter, although oil output rose 7% while natural gas and NGL production fell by a respective 22% and 23%; total FY 2017 production was 53.1M boe (37% oil), with Permian Basin oil production rising 52% Y/Y to a record 6.1M bbl.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 7 Comments
  • HLIT

    Harmonic +10.7% as revenues top Street

    • Harmonic (NASDAQ:HLIT) has jumped 10.7% in postmarket trading after revenues beat expectations in Q4 earnings despite a double-digit decline.
    • Net loss widened slightly on a GAAP basis, to $11.8M, and non-GAAP earnings swung to a $0.4M loss from a year-ago gain of $6.7M.
    • Bookings, meanwhile, were up to $122.9M from $116.9M; backlog and deferred revenue at quarter's end was up to $224.4M from a year-ago $188.4M.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $67.99M (down 17.4%); Service, $34.99M (up 5.4%).
    • Cash and short-term investments came to $57M, down from the prior year's $62.6M.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to net revenue of $83M-$93M, gross margin of 52-53%, and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.01.
    • For the full year, it's forecasting revenue of $380M-$430M, gross margin of 51-53%, and EPS of -$0.18 to $0.25.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce dips 0.5% on Q4 beats, upside guidance, +26% subscription growth

    • Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) shares drop 0.5% aftermarket on Q4 results that beat estimates with a 24.5% Y/Y revenue growth. Upside Q1 guidance has revenue from $2.925B to $2.935B (consensus: $2.9B) and EPS from $0.43 to $0.44 (consensus: $0.37).
    • Upside FY19 guidance has revenue from $12.6B to $12.65B (consensus: $12.55B) and EPS from $2.02 to $2.04 (consensus: $1.75). 
    • Key metrics: Subscription and support revenue, $2.66B (+26%); Professional services and other revenue, $196M (+7%); operating cash flow, $1.05B (+49%); total operating expenses, $2.04B; cash and equivalents, $4.52B; deferred revenue, $7.09B (+28%); unbilled deferred revenue, $13.3B (+48%); total current and noncurrent debt, $1.72B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Salesforce.com beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 9 Comments
  • NVAX

    Novavax's NanoFlu shows positive effect in Phase 1/2 study in older adults; shares up 18% after hours

    • Top-line results from a Phase 1/2 clinical trial assessing Novavax's (NASDAQ:NVAX) recombinant flu vaccine NanoFlu in older adults showed a treatment effect over and above the leading egg-based flu vaccine.
    • In three H3N2 strains, which accounted for ~3/4 of flu-related hospitalizations this year, NanoFlu produced 47 - 64% higher antibody titers compared to the egg-based high-dose vaccine.
    • The company expects to launch a Phase 2 study in Q3.
    • Shares are up 18% after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 80 Comments
  • ECR

    Eclipse Resources beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Eclipse Resources (NYSE:ECR): Q4 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $104.1M (+24.1% Y/Y) beats by $4.3M.
    • Shares +1.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 5 Comments
  • CODI

    Compass Diversified Holdings beats by $0.09, misses on revenue

    • Compass Diversified Holdings (NYSE:CODI): Q4 EPS of $0.53 beats by $0.09.
    • Revenue of $348.4M (+9.4% Y/Y) misses by $2.59M.
    • Shares +1.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • MYL

    Mylan teams up with Revance to develop Botox biosimilar

    • Mylan N.V. (NASDAQ:MYL) inks a global collaboration and license agreement with Revance Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RVNC) aimed at developing and commercializing a biosimilar to Allergan's (NYSE:AGN) BOTOX (onabotulinumtoxinA).
    • Under the terms of the deal, Mylan will pay Revance $25M upfront, milestones and royalties on net sales. Detailed financial terms are not disclosed.
    • Revance will continue to exclusively develop RT002, a long-acting neuromodulator.
    • RVNC is up 2% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 21 Comments
  • RVNC

    Revance Therapeutics misses by $0.17, misses on revenue

    • Revance Therapeutics (NASDAQ:RVNC): Q4 EPS of -$1.14 misses by $0.17.
    • Revenue of $0.04M (-50.0% Y/Y) misses by $0.04M.
    • Shares +1.2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy to seek exemption from Trump's solar tariff

    • Add Enphase Energy (NASDAQ:ENPH) to the list of U.S. solar companies seeking an exemption from the 30% tariff recently imposed by Pres. Trump, even though it does not make solar panels.
    • ENPH makes microinverters, which convert energy produced by photovoltaic panels from direct to alternating current, in the U.S. but the company ships the devices to manufacturers in Asia to attach to panels before they are sold in the U.S. - thus they are subject to the tariff.
    • ENPH soared 19% to 52-week highs in today's trade after reporting its first quarterly profit on an adjusted basis since 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 7 Comments
  • HABT

    The Habit Restaurants beats by $0.01, misses on revenue

    • The Habit Restaurants (NASDAQ:HABT): Q4 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $85.09M (+15.2% Y/Y) misses by $0.59M.
    • Shares +2.89%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): Q4 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $2.85B (+24.5% Y/Y) beats by $40M.
    • Shares +1.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 23 Comments
  • TPC

    Tutor Perini +11% after Q4 earnings beat, KeyBanc upgrade

    • Tutor Perini (TPC +10.9%) soars after KeyBanc upgrades shares to Overweight from Sector Weight with a $28 price target, which was prompted by the company's solid Q4 earnings beat.
    • TPC's Q4 results showed its highest margin Civil segment rose 54% Y/Y and the $1.4B Newark Airport terminal contract win will drive a book-to-bill above 1x in Q1 2018, the firm says.
    • TPC completed its second straight year of a free cash flow recovery after many years of poor performance, which KeyBanc says could be attributed to management's efforts on cash collections, including a new incentive comp structure which was introduced last spring.
    • The company also guided 2018 EPS to $1.90-$2.30, implying 25% Y/Y EPS growth at the midpoint, which may imply it is at the very least "comfortably achievable" if not beatable, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • CNSL

    Consolidated offers DirecTV Now across customer footprint

    • Consolidated Communications (CNSL -4.2%) says it's offering streaming service DirecTV Now (T -1.2%) to customers across its entire footprint.
    • Customers will get a free seven-day trial before having to sign up for packages starting at $35 monthly, and may be eligible for more benefits with a prepaid subscription, such as an Amazon Fire TV 4K stick.
    • Consolidated offers services across a 24-state footprint with a fiber network spanning more than 36,000 route miles. It has more than 117,000 subscribers to its IPTV service, and more than 783,000 data/Internet connections along with 990,000-plus voice customers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM | 10 Comments
  • CYH

    Community Health's Q4 revenue miss pressures shares, down 20%

    • Community Health Systems (CYH -19.7%) slumps on double normal volume after reporting Q4 results that included a revenue shortfall versus consensus that the company says was due to a $591M increase in contractual allowances and a change in its provision for bad debts.
    • Net revenues: $3.06B (-31.6%); loss/share: ($17.98) (-999%).
    • Non-GAAP EBITDA: $409M (-27.5%).
    • Cash flow ops (full-year): $773M (-32.0%).
    • 2018 guidance: Revenues: $13.6B - 13.9B; non-GAAP EBITDA: $1.55B - 1.65B; loss/share: ($1.50 - 1.10).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • RSPP

    RSP Permian +7% on strong production outlook

    • RSP Permian (RSPP +7.2%) surges even after reporting in-line Q4 earnings, as revenue rose 103% Y/Y to $249M and production soared 74%.
    • RSPP says Q4 production averaged 62.4K boe/day compared to 35.8K boe/day in the year-ago quarter and FY 2017 production jumped 89% Y/Y to 55.25K boe/day (72% oil, 88% liquids) from 29.2K a year earlier.
    • RSPP forecasts FY 2018 production to rise 30%-40% Y/Y to 72K-78K boe/day, with planned capex of $815M-$895M after spending $673M in 2017.
    • At a $50/bbl average oil price, the company expects to generate cash flow in excess of development spending by Q4 and exit 2018 at less than 2.0x net debt-to-EBITDAX.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 2 Comments

  • Dollar posts 1st monthly gain in four months

    • Traders began to unwind some of their short dollar exposure on the back of higher yields, and a jump in equity volatility.
    • Jay Powell's comments yesterday regarding the state of the economy and monetary policy provided more fuel to the unwind.
    • The euro is weaker on the back of softening inflation data, the sterling is being pressured by Brexit negotiations, and the loonie has been lower on NAFTA uncertainty. The yen is the only only major currency up against the dollar this month, primarily on the back of slowing JGB purchases and potential fiscal year-end repatriation flows to Japan.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • ETFs: UUP, UDN, USDU
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo down 7% on FDA OK of Sorrento's ZTlido

    • Endo International (ENDP -7.3%) slumps almost double normal volume in response the U.S. approval of Sorrento Therapeutics' ZTlido (lidocaine patch) 1.8% for the treatment of pain associated with post herpetic neuralgia (shingles).
    • Endo's pharmaceutical unit sells Lidoderm (lidocaine patch) 5% to which Sorrento compared ZTlido to in clinical studies. ZTlido's value proposition is the delivery of a bioequivalent therapeutic dose of lidocaine with a dose load almost 95% less (36 mg/patch vs. 700 mg/patch) which is safer for children and pets and reduces drug waste.
    • Previously: FDA OKs Sorrento's ZTlido for PHN-related pain (Feb. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 32 Comments
  • HLF

    Herbalife takes victory lap after Ackman throws in the towel

    • "Don't be afraid to get to know us," says Herbalife (HLF +6.7%) CEO Rich Goudis, following reports Bill Ackman has completely given up on his short position.
    • "The performance and resiliency of our Company is rooted in our purpose to make the world healthier and happier."
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 79 Comments
  • TWTR

    Twitter rolls out long-in-works bookmarking feature

    • Twitter (TWTR +2.8%) today launched the ability to bookmark tweets for later access, a feature often requested by users (if not the feature in highest demand).
    • It's added a "share" icon on each tweet, though which users will be able to bookmark a tweet as well as share it easily through a direct message, for example.
    • Users had called for the feature since a workaround for saving tweets -- "favoriting" them -- was publicly viewable, whereas bookmarks will be private.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM | 10 Comments
  • AWSM

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/28/18)

    • Gainers:IFON +17%. MYSZ +15%. TEUM +15%. ENPH +15%. VEEV +13%
    • Losers: FTR -22%. DQ -16%. SSYS -15%. ROG -13%. SE -13%.
      •    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • LYV

    Reported Dallas Cowboys ticketing move may ding Live Nation

    • Live Nation Entertainment (LYV -4.3%) -- already lower today after its earnings report yesterday showed increasing operating loss on concerts and a loss in ticketing -- may be taking another hit if the Dallas Cowboys switch their ticketing deal to SeatGeek.
    • An earlier report in the Dallas Business Journal says the Cowboys will join the New Orleans Saints on SeatGeek, a move that flies in the face of the NFL's master ticketing deals with Live Nation's Ticketmaster and StubHub covering the next five years, as well as Legends Hospitality (part-owned by the Cowboys) and its partnership with Live Nation.
    • The Cowboys are expected to get an equity stake of about 15% in SeatGeek, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • DELL

    Deutsche Bank initiates Dell at 57% upside

    • Deutsche Bank initiates Dell Technologies (DVMT) at Buy with a $114 price target, a 57% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Firm says Dell is a complex security that makes for more than a cheap way to get VMware (NYSE:VMW) exposure.   
    • Dell’s uncertainty grew in January when strategic option discussions drove shares down 21% and widened the discount to VMware shares to a new high of 45%. 
    • Deutsche Bank initiates coverage ahead of the Q4 reports scheduled for tomorrow (VMware) and March 8 (Dell). 
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Dell shares are up 2.7% to $74.70 with a 52-week range of $59.93 to $92.40. 
    • VMware shares are up 3.2% to $133.13 with a 52-week range of $85.45 to $165.    
    • Previously: Dell getting serious about VMware options (Feb. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • ET

    Judge explains order halting Energy Transfer's Bayou pipeline construction

    • The U.S. district judge who stopped construction of Energy Transfer Partners' (ETP -2%) Bayou Bridge oil pipeline through a Louisiana swamp concluded that the project's irreversible environmental damage outweighs the economic harm that a delay brings to the company building it.
    • In a 61-page ruling explaining her decision last week to stop construction of the pipeline in the Atchafalaya Basin, the judge says the project potentially threatens the hydrology of the basin and "poses the threat of destruction of already diminishing wetlands."
    • The preliminary injunction only applies to the basin and does not prevent ETP from working elsewhere along the pipeline's 162-mile-long path from Lake Charles to St. James Parish.
    • The company early this week asked the judge to suspend her order while it appeals but she refused, and it is asking the 5th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals to review the decision.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 157 Comments
  • SRNE

    FDA OKs Sorrento's ZTlido for PHN-related pain

    • The FDA approves Sorrento Therapeutics' (SRNE +0.6%) ZTlido (lidocaine topical system) 1.8% for the relief of pain associated with post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN).
    • Previously: FDA accepts Sorrento's resubmitted marketing application for ZTlido, action date February 28, 2018 (Sept. 12, 2017)
    • Shares are up 4% after hours on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 29 Comments
  • RSPP

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/28/2018)

    • Gainers: RSPP +9%. UNVR +6%. IO +5%. TUSK +5%.
    • Losers: FI -13%. UPL -12%. ESV -8%. ALB -8%. NE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 7 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America fires two more for sexual-misconduct

    • Both discharged employees are from the prime-brokerage unit. They were let go for interfering in an investigation into sexual-misconduct by the unit's former head Omeed Malik, who was fired back in January.
    • "Mr. Malik was discharged for personal conduct in violation of firm standards, including interfering with the firm’s review of the matter,” said Bank of America in a regulatory filing.
    • BAC +0.8%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • DKS

    Dick's higher after firearms decision seen as strategic

    • Bloomberg Intelligence thinks the assault-rifle ban by Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +1.1%) has some positive benefits from a shareholder perspective.
    • The decision could lead to more buying from large institutional investors that typically avoid holding shares of assault-rifle sellers, notes BI's Chen Grazutis.
    • Other analysts have pointed today to the likelihood that Dick's brand popularity with younger consumers will improve.
    • Dick's is out in front of broad market averages for the day with a 1.15% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 14 Comments
  • MNKD

    Maxim turns bearish on MannKind, cuts to Sell; shares down 6%

    • For what it's worth, Maxim Group has downgraded MannKind (MNKD -5.5%) to Sell with a $1 (67% downside risk) price target. Analyst Jason Kolbert says the company failed to get much of a sales bump from its TV campaign for Afrezza on the Dr. Phil and Ellen DeGeneres shows. More capital will be needed, likely on unfavorable terms.
    • Uber bull H.C. Wainwright, however, remains undeterred with a Buy rating.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 3 Comments
  • TIVO

    JPMorgan: TiVo has heavy upside in case of leveraged buyout

    • TiVo (NASDAQ:TIVO) is up 12% and has tagged its highest point since mid-December after yesterday's earnings report featured an announcement that it's looking at strategic alternatives.
    • TiVo's hired LionTree Advisors, suggesting M&A activity on the horizon.
    • JPMorgan took the opportunity to reiterate its stance that the company could be worth in the mid-$20 range in a leveraged buyout. Shares are currently at $15.15.
    • The firm's Sterling Auty updated his price target to $30, which includes $7/share in value from resolving Comcast as a customer, and implies nearly 100% upside. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • BGS

    B&G Foods falls to 52-week low

    • B&G Foods (BGS -10%) slides to a 52-week low after Q4 revenue falls short and full-year guidance is set below expectations.
    • The company sees FY18 revenue of $474M vs. $482M consensus and FY18 EPS of $2.05-$2.25 vs. $2.26 consensus.
    • B&G execs delved into inflation pressures during the company's earnings call (transcript), including mentioning higher-than-anticipated freight transportation and warehouse costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 36 Comments
  • CRZBF

    Goldman and SocGen looking to buy Commerzbank's ETF business

    • Commerzbank (OTCPK:CRZBF +0.5%) put the unit up for sale last year as it scales back trading and focuses on lending, according to Bloomberg.
    • Both Goldman (GS -0.4%) and SocGen (OTCPK:SCGLY +1.1%) have submitted final bids, and are more interested in just the ETF business, but Commerzbank wants the buyer to acquire all of its trading operations.
    • The business generated €381M in revenue in 2017 and was the only unit in the bank's corporate side to see incomes rise.
     
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • SSP

    Scripps -5.3% as profits dip

    • E.W. Scripps (NASDAQ:SSP) is off 5.3% after missed revenue expectations in Q4 earnings (and while trading ex-dividend today).
    • A boost in revenues from national media (fueled by a Katz acquisition) more than made up for a decline in its core local media segment. Revenues rose 1.6% overall.
    • Meanwhile costs for segments, shared services and corporate were up 29% to $222M, driven by the new expenses at Katz and higher network programming fees.
    • Net income fell to $11.5M from $36.3M; the current quarter includes a gain on Katz investment of $5.4M.
    • Political revenues fell $52.8M due to a non-election year.
    • Revenue by segment (after segment reorg): Local media, $202.6M (down 16.5%); National media, $52.97M (up 486.4%); Other, $1.4M (up 11.7%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to local media revenue up mid-single digits and retransmission revenue up about 10%, along with national media revenue in the mid- to high-$50M range. It's forecasting capex in the high-single digit millions.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • BGFV

    Big Five Sporting Goods recovers from early decline

    • Big Five Sportings Goods (BGFV +4.2%) tracks higher after initially being down as much as 4%.
    • The company posted in-line Q4 results yesterday during a quarter in which same-store sales fell 9.4%.
    • "Our performance was impacted by an extraordinarily challenging December period as a result of extremely unfavorable winter weather conditions in most of our markets," said CEO Steven Miller.
    • It's unclear if the turnaround in share price today on Big Five is directly attributable to the decision by Dick's to stop selling assault-style rifles.
    • Previously: Big 5 Sporting Goods EPS in-line, misses on revenue (Feb. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 8 Comments
  • PHH

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (02/28/2018)

    • Gainers: PHH +26%. NNI +10%.OCN +7%. CWH +6%.
    • Losers: MHLD -16%. LGIH -7%. LEJU -6%. SRG -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • HTZ

    Hertz down nearly 5% after results

    • Q4's adjusted net loss of $64M or $0.77 per share was wider than $59M and $0.71 a year ago, and worse than estimates for a loss of just $0.60.
    • Full-year adjusted net loss of $1.59 per share vs. net income of $0.49 per share in 2016.

    • Dosing is underway in a Phase 1 study evaluating the safety and pharmacokinetics of Cara Therapeutics' (CARA +2.3%) Oral KORSUVA (difelikefalin) in patients with chronic liver disease (CLD). The open-label trial will enroll up to 60 subjects with CLD and up to 12 healthy patients for control.
